required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Omarigliptin (MK-3102) Clinical Trial - Add-on to Oral Antihyperglycemic Agent Study in Japanese Participants With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (MK-3102-015)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Double-blinded Study and Subsequent Open-label, Extension Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Addition of MK-3102 in Japanese Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control on Diet/Exercise Therapy and Oral Antihyperglycemic Agent Monotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the safety and efficacy of the addition of omarigliptin in Japanese participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus who have inadequate glycemic control on diet/exercise therapy and oral antihyperglycemic agent monotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: The treatment period is composed of a 24-week double-blind period (Phase A) and a 28-week open-label period (Phase B). During Phase A, participants will received either omarigliptin 25 mg or a matching placebo. During Phase, B all participants will receive omarigliptin 25 mg. All participants will remain on a stable dose and administration of a single oral antihyperglycemic basal medication.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event Excluding Data After Glycemic Rescue During Phase A
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Glycemic rescue criteria were: fasting plasma glucose (FPG) of >240 mg/dL, 2 times, (Week 4 to Week 24) and after Week 24, FPG >200 mg/dL, 2 times. Glycemic rescue was achieved through up-titration of basal medication (1st rescue) and through the use of metformin or glimepiride (2nd rescue).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event Excluding Data After Glycemic Rescue During the Overall Study
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Glycemic rescue criteria were: fasting plasma glucose (FPG) of >240 mg/dL, 2 times, (Week 4 to Week 24) and after Week 24, FPG >200 mg/dL, 2 times. Glycemic rescue was achieved through up-titration of basal medication (1st rescue) and through the use of metformin or glimepiride (2nd rescue). These results represent the accrual of events over different treatment intervals: 52 weeks, Omarigliptin (Phase A+B) group, defined as the double-blind period and open-label extension period versus 28 weeks for the placebo switching to Omarigliptin group defined as the open-label extension period only.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinued From the Study Due to an Adverse Event During Phase A
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinued From the Study Due to an Adverse Event During the Overall Study
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Glycemic rescue criteria were: fasting plasma glucose (FPG) of >240 mg/dL, 2 times, (Week 4 to Week 24) and after Week 24, FPG >200 mg/dL, 2 times. Glycemic rescue was achieved through up-titration of basal medication (1st rescue) and through the use of metformin or glimepiride (2nd rescue). These results represent the accrual of events over different treatment intervals: 52 weeks, Omarigliptin (Phase A+B) group, defined as the double-blind period and open-label extension period versus 28 weeks for the placebo switching to Omarigliptin group defined as the open-label extension period only.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 HbA1c minus the Week 0 HbA1c.

arm_group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SUs throughout the duration of the study.

Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of glinides throughout the duration of the study.

Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BGs throughout the duration of the study.

Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of TZDs throughout the duration of the study.

Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of α-glucosidase (α-GIs) inhibitors throughout the duration of the study.

Placebo matching omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg is administered once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SUs throughout the duration of the study.

Placebo matching omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg is administered once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of glinides throughout the duration of the study.

Placebo matching omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg is administered once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BGs throughout the duration of the study.

Placebo matching omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg is administered once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of TZDs throughout the duration of the study.

Placebo matching omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg is administered once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of α-GIs inhibitors throughout the duration of the study.

intervention.description: Omarigliptin (MK-3102) 25 mg capsule administered orally once weekly. Pre-study basal medications include: SUs (gliclazide, glibenclamide, or glimepiride); Glinides (nateglinide , mitiglinide, or repaglinide); BGs (metformin); TZDs (pioglitazone); and α-GIs (acarbose, voglibose, or miglitol).

Matching placebo to omarigliptin 25 mg capsule administered orally once weekly. Pre-study basal medications include: SUs (gliclazide, glibenclamide, or glimepiride); Glinides (nateglinide , mitiglinide, or repaglinide); BGs (metformin); TZDs (pioglitazone); and α-GIs (acarbose, voglibose, or miglitol).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Has inadequate glycemic control on diet/exercise therapy and oral antihyperglycemic agent monotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of type 1 diabetes mellitus or a history of ketoacidosis
- History of any of the following medications: Thiazolidinediones (TZD) (for participants whose basal medication is not TZD) and/or insulin within 12 weeks prior to study participation, omarigliptin anytime

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Sixty-seven sites in Japan received IRB approval and were shipped clinical supplies in this study and randomized at least one participant. A total of 772 participants were screened of which 187 participants were excluded. The most common reason for participants not being randomized was screen failure (meeting exclusionary laboratory values).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: In Phase A, participants were randomized to receive either omarigliptin (MK-3102) 25 mg once weekly or placebo for 24 weeks in a blinded manner. In Phase B, all participants received open-label omarigliptin 25 mg once weekly for 28 weeks.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/Sulfonylureas (SU) (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SU throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/Glinides (Gln) (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of Gln throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/Biguanides (BG) (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BG throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/Thiazolidinediones (TZD) (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of TZD throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/α-GI (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of α-glucosidase (α-GI) throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Placebo/SU (Phase A) Switching to Omari. 25 mg/SU (Phase B)
group.description: Placebo to omarigliptin (omari.)administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SU throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Placebo/Gln. (Phase A) Switching to Omari. 25 mg/Gln (Phase B)
group.description: Placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of Gln throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Placebo/BG (Phase A) Switching to Omari. 25 mg/BG (Phase B)
group.description: Placebo to Omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BG. throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Placebo/TZD (Phase A) Switching to Omari. 25 mg/TZ (Phase B)
group.description: Placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of TZD throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Placebo/α-GI (Phase A) Switching to Omari. 25 mg/α-GI (Ph. B)
group.description: Placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of α-GI throughout the duration of the study.

group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SU throughout the duration of the study.

group.description: Placebo to Omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BG throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event Excluding Data After Glycemic Rescue During Phase A
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Glycemic rescue criteria were: fasting plasma glucose (FPG) of >240 mg/dL, 2 times, (Week 4 to Week 24) and after Week 24, FPG >200 mg/dL, 2 times. Glycemic rescue was achieved through up-titration of basal medication (1st rescue) and through the use of metformin or glimepiride (2nd rescue).
outcome.population: All Subjects as Treated (ASaT) population, defined as all randomized participants who received at least one study drug. Participants were included in the treatment group corresponding to the study treatment they actually received for the analysis of safety data using the ASaT population.

Participants were included in the treatment group corresponding to the study treatment they actually received for the analysis of safety data. Data was unavailable for 5 participants who discontinued from the study in the placebo arm in Phase A.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Week 24
outcome.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 HbA1c minus the Week 0 HbA1c.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS), comprised of all participants who received at least one study drug and have a baseline or post-randomization measurement.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/SU (Phase A)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SU throughout the duration of the study.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Week 24
measure.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 HbA1c minus the Week 0 HbA1c.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS), comprised of all participants who received at least one study drug and have a baseline or post-randomization measurement.

analysis.method_desc: Constrained longitudinal data analysis with terms for treatment, basal AHA medication, prior AHA therapy status except for basal medication, and time.
analysis.param_type: Difference in the least squares means

reported_events.time_frame: Phase A (up to 24 weeks), Phase A+B (up to 52 weeks). Phase B (Up to 28 weeks [Week 25 to 52])
reported_events.desc: The ASaT Population was used for this analysis. AEs occuring after glycemic rescue were included in the analysis of SAEs but not for Non-SAEs. 5 participants in the placebo arm discontinued from the study in Phase A. The AEs for the various placebo arms were grouped into 1 placebo arm regardless of the antihyperglycemic basal medication received.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/SU (Phase A)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SU throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/Gln (Phase A)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of Gln throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/BG (Phase A)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BG throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/TZD (Phase A)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of TZD throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/α-GI (Phase A)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued pre-study basal medication of α-GI throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Placebo/ABM (Phase A)
group.description: Placebo to omargliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks during Phase A. Participants continued any pre-study basal medication (ABM)throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/SU (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of SU throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/Gln (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of Gln throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/BG (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of BG throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/TZD (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of TZD throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25 mg/α-GI (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 52 weeks (24 weeks during Phase A and 28 weeks during Phase B). Participants continued pre-study basal medication of α-GI throughout the duration of the study.

group.title: Omarigliptin 25mg/ABM (Phase B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks during Phase B after switching from placebo. Participants continued any prestudy basal medications throughout the duration of the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts or presentations regarding this trial 45 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission; this confidentiality does not include efficacy and safety results.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
